intro: Romanschulzia apetala, commonly known as the naked-flowered romanschulzia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The species is characterized by its simple, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are distinctive for lacking petals, giving it the common name "naked-flowered." The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair, aiding in wind dispersal.
